005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathConstants;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IPositiveIntegerItem;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.EQNameFactory;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
013
014import java.math.BigInteger;
015import java.util.List;
016
017import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
018
019/**
020 * Support for the Metaschema <a href=
021 * "https://pages.nist.gov/metaschema/specification/datatypes/#positive-integer">positive-integer</a>
022 * data type.
023 */
024public class PositiveIntegerAdapter
025    extends AbstractIntegerAdapter<IPositiveIntegerItem> {
026  @NonNull
027  private static final List<IEnhancedQName> NAMES = ObjectUtils.notNull(
028      List.of(
029          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "positive-integer"),
030          // for backwards compatibility with original type name
031          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "positiveInteger")));
032
033  PositiveIntegerAdapter() {
034    super(IPositiveIntegerItem.class, IPositiveIntegerItem::cast);
035    // avoid general construction
036  }
037
038  @Override
039  public List<IEnhancedQName> getNames() {
040    return NAMES;
041  }
042
043  @Override
044  public IPositiveIntegerItem newItem(Object value) {
045    BigInteger item = toValue(value);
046    return IPositiveIntegerItem.valueOf(item);
047  }
048}
